body:
Comment 1: 
If you can get a backtrace from the point of failure, that might help.  Run the program
under gdb.  You should get back to the gdb prompt when the SIGSEGV signal arrives.

Note that GCC 4.8 will be released very soon; it might be interesting to try building a
GCC snapshot and use that to build your program.
_Labels changed: added **gccgo**, removed **go1.1maybe**._ _Owner changed to @ianlancetaylor._ _Status changed to **Accepted**._
